revisions.rev: {{distinguish|fc (Unix)}} {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} In [[computing]], '''fc''' ('''F'''ile '''C'''ompare) is a [[command line interface|command line]] program that compares multiple [[computer file|files]] and outputs the differences between them. The fc [[command (computing)|command]] has been included in [[Microsoft]] [[operating system]]s since [[MS-DOS]] 2.0 and is included in all versions of [[Microsoft Windows]]. The command is equivalent to the [[Unix]] commands [[comm]], [[cmp (Unix)|cmp]] and [[diff]]. http://www.microsoft.com/resources/documentation/windows/xp/all/proddocs/en-us/fc.mspx?mfr=true ==Functionality== The latest version of fc can compare [[text file]]s as well as [[binary file]]s. The text can either be encoded in [[ASCII]] or [[Unicode]]. The result of comparisons are output to the standard output. The output of fc is intended primarily to be human readable and may be difficult to use in other programs. ==See also== * [[File comparison]] * [[List of DOS commands]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Windows commands}} [[Category:DOS on IBM PC compatibles]] [[Category:DOS software]] [[Category:File comparison tools]] [[Category:Windows administration]] {{Windows-stub}}
